meanings.definition: Flatworks: a term used in construction to refer to the horizontal surfaces of a building, such as floors and roofs.
meanings.sent1: The workers carefully poured concrete to create the flatworks for the new house.
meanings.sent2: The architect designed the flatworks of the office building to be sleek and modern.
meanings.sent3: The flatworks of the building were so smooth that they reflected the sunlight like a mirror.
meanings.sent4: The flatworks of the house were like a blank canvas waiting for the final touches of paint.
meanings.sent5: Walking on the flatworks felt like stepping on a solid cloud, so soft and even.

meanings.definition: Flatworks: the act of creating or installing flat surfaces in a building.
meanings.sent1: The construction team completed the flatworks of the new apartment complex ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent2: Precision is crucial when performing flatworks to ensure the surfaces are level and stable.
meanings.sent3: The flatworks project turned into a fun challenge for the builders, like solving a giant puzzle.
meanings.sent4: The flatworks were like pieces of a jigsaw puzzle coming together to form a complete picture.
meanings.sent5: The sound of hammers and saws echoed through the building as the flatworks took shape.
